meanings.definition: Not able to be compared or measured against each other.
meanings.sent1: The sizes of the two rocks were incommensurable, making it hard to decide which one was bigger.
meanings.sent2: The incommensurable opinions of the students made it difficult to reach a consensus.
meanings.sent3: The incommensurable lengths of the spaghetti strands led to a comical scene at the dinner table.
meanings.sent4: The incommensurable talents of the two artists shone brightly in their unique creations.
meanings.sent5: The incommensurable beauty of the sunset left everyone in awe.

meanings.definition: Lacking a common standard of measurement or comparison.
meanings.sent1: The incommensurable weights of the fruits confused the scale.
meanings.sent2: The incommensurable values of the currencies made international trade challenging.
meanings.sent3: The incommensurable speeds of the snails resulted in a hilarious race.
meanings.sent4: The incommensurable flavors of the dishes created a culinary adventure.
meanings.sent5: The incommensurable colors of the flowers painted a vibrant garden.
